content:
Could anyone tell me what should be the versions for the modules on the /admin/modules page? See https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/5002

Version format for the contributed modules on the Modules page · Issue #5002 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
All is good for the core modules on the Modules page (admin/modules) as their versions always contain the Backdrop's version first and the module version after the hyphen, for example 1.19.x-de...
Dammit, can't seem to find the documentation, either. It's semver..., for instance 1.x-1.0.1 (core-major.minor.patch).

This is the best I could find: https://backdropcms.org/releases

Basically for contrib, before the hyphen is the core version, and after is the versioning described on this page.

indigoxela said:

Dammit, can't seem to find the documentation, either. It's semver..., for instance 1.x-1.0.1 (core-major.minor.patch).

So then the version numbers that show like 3.x-dev or 2.x-dev are wrong?
Ooops, where did you see 3.x-dev or 2.x-dev? Yes, that should actually be "1.x-dev" for a branch named 1.x-1.x - at least, that's how I handle things.

indigoxela said:

Ooops, where did you see 3.x-dev or 2.x-dev? Yes, that should actually be "1.x-dev" for a branch named 1.x-1.x - at least, that's how I handle things.

Please read https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/5002

Version format for the contributed modules on the Modules page · Issue #5002 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
All is good for the core modules on the Modules page (admin/modules) as their versions always contain the Backdrop's version first and the module version after the hyphen, for example 1.19.x-de...

Or this https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib#releases

backdrop-ops/contrib
Apply to join the contributed code developer team. - backdrop-ops/contrib
Fro example, if you git clone better_exposed_filters , then it shows 3.x-dev because the default branch is 1.x-3.x.

Hm... weird, module Better Exposed Filters has a properly named branch. I suspect, the misunderstanding is on my side...

HA! Sure, BEF has 1.x-3.x, hence what you see is 3.x-dev.
What the system was supposed to show for modules like better_exposed_filters? 1.x-3.x-dev?

indigoxela said:

HA! Sure, BEF has 1.x-3.x, hence what you see is 3.x-dev

and is that right? no Backdrop core version?
I don't think that the system should add the core version to the module dev version. The core version should be clear OOTB.
But don't you think it looks weird for some modules to show versions like 3.x-dev while most of other modules show 1.x- in the beginning?

In other words, if 3.x-dev is correct, then your saying:

It's semver..., for instance 1.x-1.0.1 (core-major.minor.patch).

doesn't hold. You see what I mean?

Hm... It's the module's major version...

Obviously it is a bit ambiguous, as we both had to think for a moment, if that's correct. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
I think it's a bug, and it should be 1.x-3.x-dev and not just 3.x-dev cause it really looks strange as if it's for Backdrop version 3.x

@indigoxela an you re-tag https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/5002 as a bug, please?

Version format for the contributed modules on the Modules page · Issue #5002 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
All is good for the core modules on the Modules page (admin/modules) as their versions always contain the Backdrop's version first and the module version after the hyphen, for example 1.19.x-de...

And if this will be re-tagged as a bug, then the question remains should the Modules page display versions for the contributed modules in form of core-major.minor.patch or should they contain information only for module itself in form of major.minor.patch without indicating Backdrop core?
@Alan Mels I'm currently doing some recherche, to provide some screenshots (for clarity) ... there are some inconsistencies, it seems, which justifies the "bug" label.
:thumbs_up:

Also, I'm just wondering while for the official releases we are showing versions like 1.x-1.0.0, 1.x-1.2.0 wouldn't be displaying versions like 1.x-1.x, 1.x-2.x for development branches just enough? Why the system has to add the -dev suffix and displaying them as 1.x-1.x-dev, 1.x-2.x-dev instead?
